title: How to find free job training
field_page_intro: Learn about free government job training programs. These programs can help you learn new skills to reach your career goals.

title: Housing assistance for Native Americans
field_page_intro: The government offers funding to tribes and Native American individuals and families to build, buy, and renovate housing.

title: Home weatherization and energy efficiency assistance
field_page_intro: Learn how government weatherization and energy efficiency assistance programs can help people with a low income save money on heating and cooling costs.

title: Home repair programs for Native Americans, veterans, and rural residents
field_page_intro: If you are American Indian or Alaska Native, a veteran, or live in a rural area, you may qualify for home repair help from the government. Learn about eligibility and how to apply.

title: Government home repair assistance programs
field_page_intro: Government programs can make home repairs and renovations more affordable. Find out if you are eligible for home improvement loans and learn how to apply.

title: Section 8 housing
field_page_intro: A Section 8 housing choice voucher can help you pay rent for private housing. Learn if you are eligible for a voucher and how to apply.

title: Avoid foreclosure
field_page_intro: Foreclosure happens when a lender seizes and sells a property because the homeowner does not pay the mortgage. Learn what to do if your home is at risk of foreclosure.

title: Get emergency housing
field_page_intro: Learn how to find help immediately if you are facing or experiencing homelessness. The government offers programs that can help you find short-term housing.
term_node_tid:
• Children and families
  • Housing and utilities
  • Military and veterans

title: Job programs for veterans
field_page_intro: If you are a veteran, government programs can help you and your spouse with your careers after military service.

title: Veterans death benefits
field_page_intro: A veterans burial allowance helps pay for transportation, funeral, and burial costs for an eligible veteran. If you qualify, the VA will repay a fixed amount for these costs.

title: Military tuition assistance
field_page_intro: Service members, veterans, and their families may be able to get help paying for college or training programs. Learn about the benefit programs, including the GI Bill and more.

title: Military and veteran retirement benefits
field_page_intro: If you retire from a career in the military, you may be eligible for a pension. The plan and benefits you will receive depend on your situation.

title: How to apply for an SBA disaster loan
field_page_intro: If your business or home suffered damage and is in a presidentially declared disaster area, you may qualify for financial help. Find out how to apply for a small business disaster loan.
term_node_tid:
• Disasters
  • Housing and utilities
  • Jobs and unemployment
  • Military and veterans

title: Unemployment benefits after a disaster
field_page_intro: Disaster unemployment assistance provides short-term income to people who are out of work due to a disaster. Find out if you are eligible and how to apply.

title: Mortgage help and home repair loans after a disaster
field_page_intro: If you live in a presidentially declared disaster area, you may be eligible for mortgage assistance or financial help to repair or rebuild your home.

title: How to apply for disaster assistance
field_page_intro: Presidentially declared disasters are eligible for help from FEMA. If your area is not eligible, state agencies and other organizations may offer assistance. Learn if you are eligible and how to apply.

title: D-SNAP disaster food relief
field_page_intro: D-SNAP is a program that provides short-term funds for food if you are in a presidentially declared disaster area. Find out if you are eligible and how to apply.

title: Get help with bills after a disaster
field_page_intro: Learn where to get help with utility bills, credit card payments, auto loans, and student debt after a disaster.

title: How to find housing after a disaster
field_page_intro: Learn where to search for temporary housing or a shelter near you. Find out if you qualify for financial help to pay for housing after a disaster.
field_short_description: Find a shelter and see if you qualify for help paying for housing after a disaster.

title: COVID-19 testing and vaccinations
field_page_intro: Learn how to get tested for COVID-19, get vaccinated, and stay healthy.

title: Federal jobs for veterans
field_page_intro: You may qualify for special hiring programs and veterans’ preference when you look for a job with the federal government. Learn about these programs or look for jobs by agency.

title: How to get emergency food assistance
field_page_intro: You can get immediate food assistance from government and private organizations. If you are hungry now, learn where to find food in your area.

title: Homeownership vouchers for first-time homebuyers
field_page_intro: If you have a low income and want to buy your first home, the Housing Choice Voucher homeownership program could help. It may also help you pay monthly housing expenses.

title: Government-backed home loans and mortgage assistance
field_page_intro: If you want to buy a home, a government-backed home loan or a mortgage assistance program could help. Learn about the types of loans and how to qualify and apply.

title: Find rental assistance for veterans, people with disabilities, and seniors
field_page_intro: If you are a veteran, have a disability, or are a senior, you may qualify for rental assistance. Learn about government-backed rental assistance programs and how to apply.
term_node_tid:
• Disabilities
  • Housing and utilities
  • Military and veterans
  • Retirement and seniors

title: Public housing
field_page_intro: Find out if you qualify for public housing. Learn how to locate your local public housing agency and how to apply.

title: Get subsidized housing
field_page_intro: In subsidized rental housing, the government pays apartment owners to reduce the rent for tenants with low incomes. Learn how to find this type of affordable housing.

title: Get emergency rent assistance
field_page_intro: Contact your state’s 211 program to find emergency help paying your rent.

title: How to apply for Medicaid and CHIP
field_page_intro: Medicaid insures people with a low income. The Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) covers children. Learn about eligibility and how to apply for or renew coverage.
field_short_description: Learn about Medicaid and CHIP health insurance for adults and children with a low income.

title: Get paid as a caregiver for a family member
field_page_intro: Some government programs pay family or friends of people with disabilities to help with daily activities, including personal care, giving medicine, cooking, cleaning, and more.
field_short_description: Learn how friends or family can get paid for helping people with disabilities with daily activities.

title: Get help with child care costs and learn about Head Start
field_page_intro: Learn how to find child care financial assistance and Head Start programs.

title: Early intervention and special education services for children
field_page_intro: Learn how to get your child evaluated for early intervention and special education services to help with their development and learning.
field_short_description: Learn how to get your child evaluated for early intervention and special education services.

title: Get started repaying your federal student loan
field_page_intro: Before you make student loan payments for the first time, have a plan in place. Learn about keeping costs manageable, and find out about student loan forgiveness.

title: Types of student financial aid
field_page_intro: Learn about the most common ways to get help paying for college and trade or career school. Options include grants, loans, scholarships, and work-study.

title: Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA)
field_page_intro: Use the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) to learn if you are eligible for grants, scholarships, work-study programs, and loans for college or career school.

title: The Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)
field_page_intro: The Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) lets eligible employees take unpaid leave for medical or family reasons. Learn about benefits, requirements, and how to report violations.

title: Unemployment benefits
field_page_intro: Unemployment insurance pays you money if you lose your job through no fault of your own. Learn how to apply and where to find eligibility rules.
field_short_description: Learn if you qualify for unemployment benefits and how to apply.

title: Workers' compensation
field_page_intro: Workers' compensation (workers’ comp) can help you if you experience a job-related injury or illness. Learn about the benefits and where to file a claim.

title: Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC)
field_page_intro: If you have a low income, you may be able to claim the Earned Income Tax Credit to reduce the amount of taxes you owe and possibly increase your refund.

title: Child and dependent care tax credit
field_page_intro: If you paid for your child’s or a dependent’s care while you worked or looked for a job, you may be eligible for a credit on your tax return.
field_short_description: Learn how to get a tax credit for paying for a dependent's care while you worked or looked for work.

title: Child Tax Credit and Credit for Other Dependents
field_page_intro: If you are responsible for a child or other dependent, you may qualify for a credit on your tax return.
field_short_description: If you are responsible for a child or other dependent, you may qualify for a tax credit.

title: Social Security benefits and how to apply
field_page_intro: Social Security provides a source of income when you retire or if you cannot work due to a disability. Learn about the types of Social Security benefits, how to apply, and how to get help with these benefits.

title: Get help with energy bills
field_page_intro: The LIHEAP and WAP programs help pay for heating, cooling, and home weatherization. Learn if you are eligible and how to apply. And get help if your utilities were disconnected.

title: Getting Social Security benefits if you are living outside the U.S.
field_page_intro: Most U.S. citizens can get Social Security benefits while visiting or living outside the U.S. Find out if you qualify, how to apply, and who to contact to get help.

title: Military survivor benefits and life insurance
field_page_intro: Active duty, veterans, and retirees may be eligible to enroll in programs to provide for their survivors. Find out about military and veterans survivor benefits and life insurance.
term_node_tid:
• Children and families
  • Death
  • Military and veterans
  • Retirement and seniors

title: Mental health and substance abuse help for veterans
field_page_intro: Learn how to get mental health and substance abuse help through the VA.

title: Veteran disability benefits
field_page_intro: The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) pays monthly disability benefits to qualifying veterans. Find out how it works, if you are eligible, and how to file your claim.

title: Military funeral honors
field_page_intro: Learn how the military can honor a veteran at their funeral, and find out how to get a military grave marker.

title: How to get veterans health benefits
field_page_intro: The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) offers health care to eligible veterans and their dependents. Find out if you are eligible, how to apply, and where to get medical care.

title: Veteran burial in a national cemetery
field_page_intro: The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) offers burial in national cemeteries for qualifying veterans and spouses. In some cases, their child may also be eligible.

title: How to get insurance through the ACA Health Insurance Marketplace
field_page_intro: The Affordable Care Act (ACA) gives more people access to health insurance. Use the ACA's Health Insurance Marketplace to find more affordable health insurance options.

title: Get food assistance with the WIC program
field_page_intro: The Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) can help you and your young children get food, nutrition counseling, and social service referrals.
field_short_description: WIC can help you and your young child get food, nutrition counseling, and social service referrals.

title: Learn about COBRA insurance and how to get coverage
field_page_intro: COBRA, the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act, lets qualified workers keep their group health insurance for a limited time after a change in eligibility.

title: Welfare benefits or Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF)
field_page_intro: If you or your family are experiencing financial hardship, find out how you can get help paying for food, housing, and more.
field_short_description: Find out how TANF, also known as welfare, can help your family through financial challenges.

title: Food assistance programs for older adults
field_page_intro: If you are 60 or older, you may be eligible for food assistance, depending on your income. Learn about food assistance programs for seniors and how to apply.
field_short_description: Learn about food assistance programs for people 60 and older and how to apply.

title: How to apply for food stamps (SNAP benefits) and check your balance
field_page_intro: Known previously as "food stamps," the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) can help you pay for food if you have a low income.
field_short_description: The SNAP program (food stamps) can help you pay for food if you have a low income.

title: Get help paying for phone and internet service
field_page_intro: Lifeline is a federal program that helps people with a low income get discounted telephone or internet service. Learn about eligibility, applying, and getting help with your service.

title: School meals and food programs for children
field_page_intro: Your child may qualify for free or reduced-price meals at their school or childcare center. They can get food assistance throughout the school year and during summer break.

title: SSDI and SSI benefits for people with disabilities
field_page_intro: Learn how you may be eligible for benefits through Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) or Supplemental Security Income (SSI) if you have a disability or are 65 or over.
field_short_description: Learn about Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI) and Supplemental Security Income (SSI).

title: Financial assistance and services for Native Americans
field_page_intro: Federally recognized tribes can apply for government funding for services and programs. Some programs provide funds directly to tribal members living on or near reservations.

title: How and when to apply for Medicare
field_page_intro: Learn how Medicare works and how to sign up based on your situation. Find out where to get help with your benefits or replace your Medicare card.
field_short_description: Find out about Medicare for people 65 and older or who qualify because of illness or disability.

title: How to get help with medical bills
field_page_intro: Find out how you can get help with medical bills through free or low-cost medical care, government health insurance programs, or a medical debt management plan.

title: Find help for substance abuse
field_page_intro: Find emergency hotlines, counseling, and treatment options for help with substance abuse.

title: Food assistance for Native Americans
field_page_intro: The Food Distribution Program on Indian Reservations (FDPIR) provides monthly packages of healthy food. You may be eligible based on income, tribal membership, and where you live.

title: Find help for mental health
field_page_intro: Find emergency hotlines, counseling, and treatment options for help with mental health.

title: Job training and employment programs for people with disabilities
field_page_intro: If you have a disability and are looking for work, these resources can help.
